fields.description:
*Assessment*

Using --region option with euca-describe-services doesn't work.  The following error is seen:
{code}
[root@odc-c-06 ~]# euca-describe-services --region eucalyptus-admin@BobMarley
__init__() got an unexpected keyword argument 'region'
{code}

This is using the following euca2ools and Eucalyptus versions:
{code}
[root@odc-c-06 ~]# euca-version
euca2ools 3.0.2 (Sparta)
eucalyptus 3.4.0
{code}

*Signs*

Although --region is an option that euca-describe-services says it supports:
{code}
[root@odc-c-06 ~]# euca-describe-services --help
Usage: euca-describe-services [options] service-name

	service-name - [SERVICE-NAME]*

Get services

Options:
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  -A, --all             Include all public service information.  Reported
                        state information is determined by the view available
                        to the target host, which should be treated as
                        advisory (See documentation for guidance on
                        interpreting this information).
  --system-internal     Include internal services information (note: this
                        information is only for the target host).
  --user-services       Include services which are user facing and are co-
                        located with some other top-level service (note: this
                        information is only for the target host).
  -T FILTER_TYPE, --filter-type=FILTER_TYPE
                        Filter services by component type.
  -H FILTER_HOST, --filter-host=FILTER_HOST
                        Filter services by host.
  -F FILTER_STATE, --filter-state=FILTER_STATE
                        Filter services by state.
  -P FILTER_PARTITION, --filter-partition=FILTER_PARTITION
                        Filter services by partition.
  -E, --events          Show service event details.
  --events-verbose      Show verbose service event details.

  Standard Options:
    -D, --debug         Turn on all debugging output
    --debugger          Enable interactive debugger on error
    -U URL, --url=URL   Override service URL with value provided
    --region=REGION     Name of the region to connect to
    -I ACCESS_KEY_ID, --access-key-id=ACCESS_KEY_ID
                        Override access key value
    -S SECRET_KEY, --secret-key=SECRET_KEY
                        Override secret key value
    --version           Display version string
{code}

--region is an unexpected argument.  

When using the debugging flag, the following can be seen regarding the error:
{code}
[root@odc-c-06 ~]# euca-describe-services --region eucalyptus-admin@BobMarley -D
2013-10-10 08:23:35,443 DescribeServices [DEBUG]:request_params: {'ShowEvents': 'false', 'ListUserServices': 'false', 'ListInternal': 'false', 'service_names': [], 'ShowEventStacks': 'false', 'ListAll': 'false'}
__init__() got an unexpected keyword argument 'region'
{code}

*Steps*
* Install euca2ools and Eucalyptus from the following repos:
** euca2ools {code}http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/api/1/genrepo/?distro=centos&releasever=6&arch=x86_64&url=git://github.com/eucalyptus/euca2ools&ref=3.0-maint{code}
** Eucalyptus {code}http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/api/1/genrepo/?distro=centos&releasever=6&arch=x86_64&url=repo-euca@git.eucalyptus-systems.com:eucalyptus&ref=master&allow-old{code}
* After registering each cloud component, grab the creds for the admin user of the eucalyptus account
* Set up euca2ools.ini file
{code}
[root@odc-c-06 ~]# cat .euca/euca2ools.ini
; Main euca2ools configuration file

[global]
default-region = BobMarley

[user eucalyptus-admin]
key-id = AKIZKYODDZPMV9XQWN8R
secret-key = oMRe5tgg8OlTquo6eFVmeeTowoCiNNlORiZx2lYe
account-id = 407837561996
private-key = /root/euca2-admin-b1911246-pk.pem
certificate = /root/euca2-admin-b1911246-cert.pem

[region BobMarley]
autoscaling-url = http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/AutoScaling/
ec2-url = http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/Eucalyptus
elasticloadbalancing-url = http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/LoadBalancing/
iam-url = http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/Euare/
monitoring-url = http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/CloudWatch/
s3-url = http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/Walrus/
sts-url = http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/Tokens/

; Eucalyptus-specific services, most of which are cloud admin-only
configuration-url = http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/Configuration/
empyrean-url = http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/Empyrean/
properties-url = http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/Properties/
reporting-url = http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/Reporting/

certificate = /var/lib/eucalyptus/keys/cloud-cert.pem
{code}
* Run euca-describe-services with the --region option

*Pertinent Data*

Here are the detailed package versions installed regarding euca2ools and Eucalyptus:
{code}
[root@odc-c-06 ~]# rpm -qa | grep euca
eucalyptus-admin-tools-3.4.0-0.0.1592.20131004git8aa607bc.el6.noarch
eucalyptus-walrus-3.4.0-0.0.1592.20131004git8aa607bc.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-3.4.0-0.0.1592.20131004git8aa607bc.el6.x86_64
python-eucadmin-3.4.0-0.0.1592.20131004git8aa607bc.el6.noarch
eucalyptus-common-java-3.4.0-0.0.1592.20131004git8aa607bc.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-cloud-3.4.0-0.0.1592.20131004git8aa607bc.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-load-balancer-image-1.0.2-0.127.131002git65fc4e1.el6.x86_64
euca2ools-3.0.2-0.0.120.el6.noarch
eucalyptus-common-java-libs-3.4.0-0.0.1592.20131004git8aa607bc.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-enterprise-storage-san-equallogic-libs-3.4.0-0.0.1525.20131003git8600d52c.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-sos-plugins-0.1.2-0.el6.noarch
{code}
fields.environment:

SERVICE	jetty          	eucalyptus     	10.104.10.6    	ENABLED   	30  	http://10.104.10.6:8773/services/Jetty  	arn:euca:eucalyptus::jetty:10.104.10.6/

SERVICE	cluster        	Legend         	IsThisLove     	ENABLED   	30  	http://10.104.1.185:8774/axis2/services/EucalyptusCC	arn:euca:eucalyptus:Legend:cluster:IsThisLove/

comments.body: When the admin tools finally get ported to requestbuilder this should likely Just Work (tm).
euca-describe-services is deprecated in eucalyptus 4.2 and will not be developed further.  The same release introduces empyrean-describe-services, which supports euca2ools.ini files.

[~gholms]:

Should there be something that tells users that {{euca-describe-services}} is deprecated?  Maybe in the "--help" option?  Currently, I see this:
{code}
[root@g-19-05 ~]# euca-describe-services --help
Usage: euca-describe-services [options] service-name

	service-name - [SERVICE-NAME]*

Get services

Options:
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  -A, --all             Include all public service information.  Reported
                        state information is determined by the view available
                        to the target host, which should be treated as
                        advisory (See documentation for guidance on
                        interpreting this information).
  --system-internal     Include internal services information (note: this
                        information is only for the target host).
  --user-services       Include services which are user facing and are co-
                        located with some other top-level service (note: this
                        information is only for the target host).
  -T FILTER_TYPE, --filter-type=FILTER_TYPE
                        Filter services by component type.
  -H FILTER_HOST, --filter-host=FILTER_HOST
                        Filter services by host.
  -F FILTER_STATE, --filter-state=FILTER_STATE
                        Filter services by state.
  -P FILTER_PARTITION, --filter-partition=FILTER_PARTITION
                        Filter services by partition.
  -E, --events          Show service event details.
  --events-verbose      Show verbose service event details.

  Standard Options:
    -D, --debug         Turn on all debugging output
    --debugger          Enable interactive debugger on error
    -U URL, --url=URL   Override service URL with value provided
    --region=REGION     Name of the region to connect to
    -I ACCESS_KEY_ID, --access-key-id=ACCESS_KEY_ID
                        Override access key value
    -S SECRET_KEY, --secret-key=SECRET_KEY
                        Override secret key value
    --version           Display version string
{code}

I think having something that signals these are deprecated commands will be helpful (in addition to our documentation).

Fixed by {{empyrean-describe-services}} implementation.

Eucalyptus version:  {{4.2.0 commit: b6850d4ad9d2515091c7520f988a0cd36f5f383d}}

*Steps*

# Built Eucalyptus 4.2.0 cloud from source - [QA Build - hspencer-779|http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Master/779/]
# Created euc2ools config file for cloud administrator
# Used {{empyrean-describe-services}} to describe cloud services
{code}
# empyrean-describe-services --region euca-admin@localhost --show-headers
SERVICE  TYPE                  ZONE               NAME                            STATE
SERVICE  autoscaling           API_10.111.5.83    API_10.111.5.83.autoscaling     enabled
SERVICE  autoscalingbackend    eucalyptus         10.111.5.8                      enabled
SERVICE  bootstrap             bootstrap          10.111.5.8                      enabled
SERVICE  cloudformation        API_10.111.5.83    API_10.111.5.83.cloudformation  enabled
SERVICE  cloudwatch            API_10.111.5.83    API_10.111.5.83.cloudwatch      enabled
SERVICE  cloudwatchbackend     eucalyptus         10.111.5.8                      enabled
SERVICE  cluster               at-long-last-asap  at-long-last-asap-cc-1          enabled
SERVICE  compute               API_10.111.5.83    API_10.111.5.83.compute         enabled
SERVICE  dns                   API_10.111.5.83    API_10.111.5.83.dns             enabled
SERVICE  euare                 API_10.111.5.83    API_10.111.5.83.euare           enabled
SERVICE  eucalyptus            eucalyptus         10.111.5.8                      enabled
SERVICE  identity              API_10.111.5.83    API_10.111.5.83.identity        enabled
SERVICE  imaging               API_10.111.5.83    API_10.111.5.83.imaging         enabled
SERVICE  imagingbackend        eucalyptus         10.111.5.8                      enabled
SERVICE  jetty                 eucalyptus         10.111.5.8                      enabled
SERVICE  loadbalancing         API_10.111.5.83    API_10.111.5.83.loadbalancing   enabled
SERVICE  loadbalancingbackend  eucalyptus         10.111.5.8                      enabled
SERVICE  notifications         eucalyptus         10.111.5.8                      enabled
SERVICE  objectstorage         API_10.111.5.83    API_10.111.5.83.objectstorage   enabled
SERVICE  pollednotifications   eucalyptus         10.111.5.8                      enabled
SERVICE  reporting             bootstrap          10.111.5.8                      enabled
SERVICE  simpleworkflow        API_10.111.5.83    API_10.111.5.83.simpleworkflow  enabled
SERVICE  storage               at-long-last-asap  at-long-last-asap-sc-1          enabled
SERVICE  tokens                API_10.111.5.83    API_10.111.5.83.tokens          enabled
SERVICE  user-api              API_10.111.5.83    API_10.111.5.83                 enabled
SERVICE  walrusbackend         walrus             walrus-1                        enabled

# empyrean-describe-services --region euca-admin@localhost --filter service-type=dns
SERVICE  dns  API_10.111.5.83  API_10.111.5.83.dns  enabled

# empyrean-describe-services --region euca-admin@localhost --filter service-type=autoscaling
SERVICE  autoscaling  API_10.111.5.83  API_10.111.5.83.autoscaling  enabled

# empyrean-describe-services --region euca-admin@localhost --filter availability-zone=eucalyptus
SERVICE  autoscalingbackend    eucalyptus  10.111.5.8  enabled
SERVICE  cloudwatchbackend     eucalyptus  10.111.5.8  enabled
SERVICE  eucalyptus            eucalyptus  10.111.5.8  enabled
SERVICE  imagingbackend        eucalyptus  10.111.5.8  enabled
SERVICE  jetty                 eucalyptus  10.111.5.8  enabled
SERVICE  loadbalancingbackend  eucalyptus  10.111.5.8  enabled
SERVICE  notifications         eucalyptus  10.111.5.8  enabled
SERVICE  pollednotifications   eucalyptus  10.111.5.8  enabled

# empyrean-describe-services --region euca-admin@localhost --filter availability-zone=at-long-last-asap
SERVICE  cluster  at-long-last-asap  at-long-last-asap-cc-1  enabled
SERVICE  storage  at-long-last-asap  at-long-last-asap-sc-1  enabled
{code}
